JPN100.name: Language and Culture in Japan Level 1
JPN100.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN100.description: Intensive Japanese language and culture in Japan.

JPN101.name: Elementary Japanese I
JPN101.description: Beginning-level speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and grammar. Introduction to Hiragana and Katakana writing systems and some Kanji. Aspects of culture. Emphasis on accurate communication.

JPN102.name: Elementary Japanese II
JPN102.description: Further work on beginning-level speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and grammar. Continued emphasis on accurate communication. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture.

JPN200.name: Language and Culture in Japan Level 2
JPN200.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN200.description: Intensive Japanese language and culture in Japan.

JPN201.name: Second-Year Japanese I
JPN201.description: Intermediate-level speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and grammar. Aspects of culture. Additional Kanji. Emphasis on accurate communication.

JPN202.name: Second-Year Japanese II
JPN202.description: Continuation of JPN 201. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture. Continued emphasis on accurate communication.

JPN290.name: Independent Study
JPN290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN290.description: Special projects in Japanese studies arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

JPN300.name: Language and Culture in Japan Level 3
JPN300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN300.description: Intensive Japanese language and culture in Japan.

JPN301.name: Third-Year Japanese I
JPN301.description: High intermediate-level speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and grammar of modern Japan. Use of some authentic materials, both spoken and written. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture. Class conducted mostly in Japanese.

JPN302.name: Third-Year Japanese II
JPN302.description: Continuation of JPN 301. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture. Class conducted mostly in Japanese.

JPN350.name: Studies in Japanese Language
JPN350.description: Outline of the Japanese language, partly taught in English. History, styles, socio-linguistic issues (e.g. honorifics, gender differences, dialects). Review of important structures and phrases.

JPN369.name: Introduction to Japanese Literature and Culture
JPN369.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
JPN369.description: Critical concepts and tools necessary to analyze discourses on Japanese culture and literature. Key issues in Japanese studies, including the emergence of pre-modern and modern literary genres and styles, the canonization of national literature, and the nature of translation and transformation. Taught in English and Japanese.
JPN369.prerequisite: {(IAH 211B or IAH 211C or IAH 211D or IAH 221B or IAH 221C or IAH 231B or IAH 231C or IAH 241A or IAH 241C or IAH 241D) or (HST 369 or HST 370)} and JPN 202 and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

JPN400.name: Language and Culture in Japan Level 4
JPN400.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN400.description: Intensive Japanese language and culture in Japan.

JPN401.name: Fourth-Year Japanese I
JPN401.description: Advanced work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing. Some classical grammar. Extensive use of original technical and non-technical materials, both spoken and written. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture. Class conducted entirely in Japanese.

JPN402.name: Fourth-Year Japanese II
JPN402.description: Continuation of JPN 401. Additional Kanji and aspects of culture.

JPN431.name: Advanced Spoken Japanese
JPN431.description: Present-day spoken Japanese. Mastery of common advanced vocabulary and grammar, Various aspects of Japanese culture and social interaction. Video and web materials and role-play practices. Taught entirely in Japanese.

JPN441.name: Japanese Short Stories
JPN441.description: Short stories from various genres. Reading strategies. Onomatopoeia. Taught entirely in Japanese.

JPN451.name: Advanced Japanese for Japanese Language Proficiency Test Preparation
JPN451.description: Preparation for Japanese Language Proficiency Test Levels 1 or 2. Practice in advanced-level Kanji (Chinese character), grammar, and reading comprehension. Advanced speaking practice. Taught entirely in Japanese.

JPN469.name: Research Seminar in Japanese Literature and Culture (W)
JPN469.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
JPN469.description: Critical concepts and tools for analysis of discourses on Japanese culture and literature. Re-examination of the received notion of Japanese uniqueness through focused investigation of a specific foundational literary narrative in circulation via various cultural mediums in the twenty-first century. Taught in English and Japanese.
JPN469.prerequisite: (JPN 369) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

JPN490.name: Independent Study
JPN490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JPN490.description: Special projects in Japanese studies arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
JPN490.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores. Approval of department.

JPN491.name: Topics in Japanese Studies
JPN491.description: Selected topics in the language and culture of Japan.

JPN493.name: Study Abroad Experience in Japan
JPN493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

JPN499.name: Senior Thesis Research
JPN499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
JPN499.description: Individual research project supervised by a faculty member that demonstrates the student's ability to do independent research and submit or present a major paper.
